name: Dwarf Tall Fescue Blend - Evergreen
description:
Our most popular cool-season turfgrass is a blend of improved fescue and bluegrass which has year-round dark green color. The "Plus" is that it will gradually repair minor damage over time without the need for reseeding. It has a medium leaf blade, disease resistance, partial shade tolerance and a deep root system for drought tolerance. It is easy to care for and adapts well to the varied climates and soils of the West. 

Great for Children and small pets. 

WATERING: 
For the first 20 days, water as needed to keep the topsoil moist to a 3-inch depth. After 20 days, water three or more times a week during warm weather. In cooler weather, water once or twice a week. Sandy soil requires more frequent watering than clay soil. Inland areas require more water than coastal areas. Special attention should be paid to slopes and mounds where runoff occurs. More frequent, shorter watering may be necessary.

FERTILIZATION: 
Fertilize 7 days after installation and in six to eight week intervals, depending on your lawn’s color. Light green is an indication that your lawn needs fertilizer. Use an all purpose fertilizer, and follow label directions. Applying a fertilizer with Nitrogen in the heat of summer will increase the potential for disease. Instead, apply a fertilizer consisting primarily of Iron at four to eight week intervals during the summer.

MOWING: 
Mow seven days after installation. Mow to a height of 1 1/2 to 2 1/2 inches. Weekly mowing recommended except in cold weather, when mowing may be less frequent. Never mow more than one third of the blade at one time; it may injure the plant.

If you do not see the sq' ft. needed please call 562-682-9323 to order.

Minimum order of 512 sq. ft' 

DELIVERY:
512 - 1023 sq. ft' -  $50.00 Delivery Fee (included in price below)

name: Overseeded Tifway Bermuda -Full Sun Grass
description:
A versatile hybrid Bermuda which tolerates close mowing and is disease resistant. It spreads rapidly to provide a dense turf which is wear tolerant and heals quickly. This water conservative grass becomes dormant in the winter and may develop some thatch. To avoid color change during the cool season this Bermuda has been overseeded with perennial ryegrass.

MOWING:
Mow seven days after installation. Mow to a height of 3/8 to 3/4 inches. Overseeded Tifway Bermuda should be mowed at least once a week. Never mow more than one third of the blade at one time; it may injure the plant.  This Bermuda can be mowed with both Reel and Sharp Rotary Mower.

WATERING: 
For the first 20 days, water as needed to keep the topsoil moist to a 3-inch depth. After 20 days, water three or more times a week during warm weather. In cooler weather, water once or twice a week. Sandy soil requires more frequent watering than clay soil. Inland areas require more water than coastal areas. Special attention should be paid to slopes and mounds where runoff occurs. More frequent, shorter watering may be necessary.

DETHATCHING: 
To minimize thatch, dethatch at least once every two years. It may be done as often as once a year. The preferable time to dethatch is in the spring.

DELIVERY: 
512 - 1023 sq. ft' - $50.00 Delivery Fee (included in price below)

name: BallPark Blend - Sports Turf  -COMING SOON-
description:
This versatile blend of turfgrass species will adapt to a variety of uses and maintenance regimens. We start with a healthy stand of warm-season Hybrid Bermuda and overseed with a blend of cool-season Ryegrass and Kentucky Bluegrass. The Hybrid Bermuda tolerates heavy traffic and high temperatures. The Ryegrass and Kentucky Bluegrass tolerate shade and offer winter color. All three varieties in our Ballpark Mix have a fine leaf texture.

WATERING: 
For the first 20 days, water as needed to keep the topsoil moist but not soggy to a 3-inch depth. Two or three cycles per day may be needed. After 20 days, water three or more times a week during warm weather. In cooler weather, water once or twice a week. Sandy soil requires more frequent watering than clay soil. Inland areas require more water than coastal areas. Special attention should be paid to slopes and mounds where runoff occurs. More frequent, shorter watering may be necessary. It is best to water between the hours of 4 and 10 AM for less wind evaporation and less risk of disease.

MOWING: 
Mow seven to ten days after installation. Mow to a height of ¾ to 1 ¼ inches. Ballpark mix can be mowed with either a rotary or reel mower. Never mow more than one third of the blade at any one time as it may injure the plant.

DETHATCHING: 
Dethatch every one or two years. The preferable time to dethatch is in the spring.

name: St. Augustine - AVAILABLE SPRING 2014 -
description:
St. Augustine is the most shade tolerant of all warm-season grasses.  We offer “Palmetto,” a semi-dwarf variety noted for its exceptional cold tolerance and extended growing season.  Its deep root system provides superior drought and heat tolerance.  The dark-green color and medium-fine blade delivers exceptional uniformity under a wide range of light conditions.  It has a coarse texture with a soft blade.  Palmetto will go dormant in the cooler winter months.

WATERING: 
For the first 20 days, water as needed to keep the topsoil moist to a 3-inch depth. After 20 days, water three or more times a week during warm weather. In cooler weather, water once or twice a week. Very little water is required during winter dormancy. Sandy soil requires more frequent watering than clay soil. Inland areas require more water than coastal areas. Special attention should be paid to slopes where runoff occurs and more frequent, shorter watering may be necessary. It is best to water between the hours of 4 and 10 AM for less wind evaporation.

FERTILIZATION: 
Fertilize in six to eight week intervals during warm weather, depending on your lawn’s color. Light green is an indication that your lawn needs fertilizer. Use an all-purpose fertilizer and follow label directions.

MOWING: 
Mow seven to ten days after installation. Mow to a height of 1 ½ to 2 ½ inches with a rotary mower. St. Augustine should be mowed at least once a week during the warm season. Never mow more than one third of the blade at one time; it may injure the plant. During the fall, mowing height should be raised ½ inch to increase leaf area. The increased leaf area will help the grass accumulate energy reserves for the winter and help prevent weed invasion during the dormant season.

DETHATCHING: 
To minimize thatch, dethatch at least once every two years. It may be done as often as once a year. The preferable time to dethatch is in the spring.

Minimum order of 400 sq. ft'

name: Bermuda - Full Sun Grass - AVAILABLE SPRING 2014 -
description:
A hybrid Bermuda grass with a natural dark green color and medium leaf texture. It has an aggressive growth habit for quick recovery from high traffic and can be mowed with either a rotary or reel mower. This turfgrass is water conservative and becomes dormant in winter yet exhibits early spring green-up. May develop some thatch. 

If you do not see sq' ft. needed please call 562-682-9323 to order.

MOWING:
Mow seven days after installation. Mow to a height of 3/8 to 3/4 inches. Overseeded Tifway Bermuda should be mowed at least once a week. Never mow more than one third of the blade at one time; it may injure the plant.  This Bermuda can be mowed with both Reel and Sharp Rotary Mower.

WATERING: 
For the first 20 days, water as needed to keep the topsoil moist to a 3-inch depth. After 20 days, water three or more times a week during warm weather. In cooler weather, water once or twice a week. Sandy soil requires more frequent watering than clay soil. Inland areas require more water than coastal areas. Special attention should be paid to slopes and mounds where runoff occurs. More frequent, shorter watering may be necessary.

DETHATCHING: 
To minimize thatch, dethatch at least once every two years. It may be done as often as once a year. The preferable time to dethatch is in the spring.
